tool.name: PeakPickerWavelet
tool.description: Finds mass spectrometric peaks in profile mass spectra.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: input profile data file
Minimal signal to noise ratio for a peak to be picked
Percentage of the maximum height that the raw data points must exceed to be taken into account for the calculation of the centroid
param.help: If it is 1 the centroid position corresponds to the position of the highest intensity

param.label: Approximate fwhm of the peaks
Flag if the average peak width shall be estimated
param.help: Attention: when this flag is set, the peak_width is ignored

param.label: Factor that calculates the minimal fwhm value from the peak_width
param.help: All peaks with width smaller than fwhm_bound_factor * peak_width are discarded

param.label: Factor that calculates the maximal fwhm value from the peak_width
param.help: All peaks with width greater than fwhm_upper_bound_factor * peak_width are discarded

param.label: maximal number of iterations for the fitting step
penalty term for the fitting of the position:If it differs too much from the initial one it can be penalized
penalty term for the fitting of the left width:If the left width differs too much from the initial one during the fitting it can be penalized
penalty term for the fitting of the right width:If the right width differs too much from the initial one during the fitting it can be penalized
penalty term for the fitting of the intensity (only used in 2D Optimization):If it gets negative during the fitting it can be penalized
mz tolerance for cluster construction
maximal peak distance in mz in a cluste
Minimal peak intensity
Minimal peak intensity for MS/MS peaks
minimal correlation of a peak and the raw signal
param.help: If a peak has a lower correlation it is skipped

param.label: noise level for the search of the peak endpoints
search radius for the search of the maximum in the signal after a maximum in the cwt was found
Spacing of the CWT
param.help: Note that the accuracy of the picked peak's centroid position depends in the Raw data spacing, i.e., 50% of raw peak distance at most

param.label: If you want heavily overlapping peaks to be separated set this value to "true"
If the symmetry of a peak is smaller than asym_thresholds it is assumed that it consists of more than one peak and the deconvolution procedure is started
1/left_width is the initial value for the left width of the peaks found in the deconvolution step
1/right_width is the initial value for the right width of the peaks found in the deconvolution step
Initial scaling of the cwt used in the separation of heavily overlapping peaks
param.help: The initial value is used for charge 1, for higher charges it is adapted to scaling/charge

param.label: If the FWHM of a peak is higher than 'fwhm_thresholds' it is assumed that it consists of more than one peak and the deconvolution procedure is started
if the absolute error gets smaller than this value the fitting is stopped
if the relative error gets smaller than this value the fitting is stopped
maximal number of iterations for the fitting step
penalty term for the fitting of the peak position:If the position changes more than 0.5Da during the fitting it can be penalized as well as discrepancies of the peptide mass rule
penalty term for the fitting of the intensity:If it gets negative during the fitting it can be penalized
penalty term for the fitting of the left width:If the left width gets too broad or negative during the fitting it can be penalized
penalty term for the fitting of the right width:If the right width gets too broad or negative during the fitting it can be penalized
maximal intensity considered for histogram construction
param.help: By default, it will be calculated automatically (see auto_mode). Only provide this parameter if you know what you are doing (and change 'auto_mode' to '-1')! All intensities EQUAL/ABOVE 'max_intensity' will not be added to the histogram. If you choose 'max_intensity' too small, the noise estimate might be too small as well. If chosen too big, the bins become quite large (which you could counter by increasing 'bin_count', which increases runtime)

param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 0): mean + 'auto_max_stdev_factor' * stdev
parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 1): auto_max_percentile th percentile
method to use to determine maximal intensity: -1 --> use 'max_intensity'; 0 --> 'auto_max_stdev_factor' method (default); 1 --> 'auto_max_percentile' method
window length in Thomson
number of bins for intensity values
multiplier for stdev
minimum number of elements required in a window (otherwise it is considered sparse)
noise value used for sparse windows
Write additional information about the picked peaks (maximal intensity, left and right area...) into the mzML-file
param.help: Attention: this can blow up files, since seven arrays are stored per spectrum!

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
